Package cosc202.andie

Class KeyboardShortcuts

java.lang.Object
cosc202.andie.KeyboardShortcuts
public class KeyboardShortcuts extends Object

Class used to store and create keyboard shortcuts for the features and functions implemented in A Non-Destructive Image Editor (ANDIE).

The KeyboardShortcuts class contains methods that allow the user to set keyboard shortcuts for a given action, which work for both Windows, MacOs and Linux based operating systems based on pre established common conventions like Ctrl - c to copy for Windows and Linux and Command - c for MacOs.

  • Constructor Details

    • KeyboardShortcuts

      public KeyboardShortcuts()

  • Method Details

    • getCtrlKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke getCtrlKeyStroke(KeyEvent key)

      A method that returns a keystroke instance that represents a keyboard shortcut with the Ctrl key on Windows and Linux and the command key on MacOS

      This method checks the name of the operating system to determine whether their is the word "mac" within the name, and modifies the key accordingly. If this is the case it uses the command key for MacOS and if not it used the Ctrl key for Windows and Linux.

      Parameters:
      key - The keyevent containing the keycode we want to assign
      Returns:
      A keystroke instance of the given keyevent with the modifiers added

    • getKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke getKeyStroke(KeyEvent key)

      A method that returns a keystroke instance that represents a keyboard shortcut with the given key

      This method assigns a keystroke to the given keyevent

      Parameters:
      key - The keyevent containing the keycode we want to assign
      Returns:
      A keystroke instance of the given keyevent

    • getAltKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke getAltKeyStroke(KeyEvent key)

      A method that returns a keystroke instance that represents a keyboard shortcut with the Alt key on Windows and Linux and the Option key on MacOS

      This method checks the name of the operating system to determine whether their is the word "mac" within the name, and modifies the key accordingly. If this is the case it uses the option key for MacOS and if not it uses the Alt key for Windows and Linux

      Parameters:
      key - The keyevent containing the keycode we want to assign
      Returns:
      A keystroke instance of the given keyevent with the modifies added

    • getCtrlAltKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke getCtrlAltKeyStroke(KeyEvent key)

      A method that returns a keystroke instance that represents a keyboard shortcut with Ctrl-Alt on Windows and Linux and command-option on MacOS

      This method check the name of the operating system to determine whether their is the word "mac" within the name, and modifies the key accordingly. If this is the case it uses command-option for MacOS and if not it uses Ctrl-Alt for Windows and Linux

      Parameters:
      key - The keyevent containing the keycode we want to assign
      Returns:
      A keystroke instance of the given keyevent with the modifiers added

    • getCtrlShiftKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke getCtrlShiftKeyStroke(KeyEvent key)

      A method that returns a keystroke instance that represents a keyboard shortcut with the Ctrl-shift key on Windows and Linux and the command-shift on MacOS

      This method checks the name of the operating system to determine whether their is the word "mac" within the name, and modifies the key accordingly. If this is the case it uses command-shift for MacOS and Ctrl-shift for Windows and Linux

      Parameters:
      key - The keyevent containing the keycode we want to assign
      Returns:
      A keystroke instance of the given keyevent with the modifiers added

    • getAltShiftKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke getAltShiftKeyStroke(KeyEvent key)

      A method that returns a keystroke instance that represents a keyboard shortcut with the Alt-shift key on Windows and Linux and the option-shift key on MacOS

      This method checks the name of the operating system to determine whether their is the word "mac" within the name, and modifies the key accordingly. If this is the case it uses the option-shift for MacOS and if not it uses Alt-shift for Windows and Linux

      Parameters:
      key - The keyevent containing the keycode we want to assign
      Returns:
      A keystroke instance of the given keyevent with the modifiers added

    • getShiftKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke getShiftKeyStroke(KeyEvent key)

      A method that returns a keystroke instance that represents a keyboard shortcut with the shift key

      This method assigns a keystroke to the given keyevent with the shift key added

      Parameters:
      key - The keyevent containing the keycode we want to assign
      Returns:
      A keystroke instance of the given keyevent with the modifies added
